name: NYDailyNews
text:
New York’s Hometown Newspaper captured the AP awards for 2019 breaking stories, front page headlines and more.

Congratulations to our staff and editors. See you at next year's contest!
https://t.co/3hL7ipKqBn

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Demonstrators flooded lower Manhattan to protest police brutality and George Floyd’s death.

The angry demonstrators were closely watched by New York cops — and some of them tagged NYPD vehicles with anti-police sentiments.
https://t.co/sOOKKCwEXz

name: NYDailyNews
text:
A Texas tavern banned mask-wearing customers during "ridiculous fearful times."

“If we’re only allowed to be at 25% capacity, I want them to be the 25% of people that aren’t p-----, that aren’t sheep,” owner Kevin Smith said.
https://t.co/ugUB5YE1ty

name: NYDailyNews
text:
UPDATE: The White House lock down is over, an hour after the Secret Service locked the building down.

In Washington, the protests spread throughout the city, and less-protected buildings were tagged with anti-Trump graffiti.
https://t.co/XMcBakQuF4

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Queens DA Melinda Katz will not appeal after a judge overturned a man’s 2001 attempted murder conviction in an armored car robbery.

Robert Majors, 54, had spent more than 20 years behind bars for attempted murder and other charges.
https://t.co/bRz0Xw3ZV9

name: NYDailyNews
text:
EDITORIAL: Charges filed against officer Derek Chauvin in the death of George Floyd should be the first step toward justice in a city aflame.

Through it all, public officials have failed their people.
https://t.co/rdGzcqnsyI

name: NYDailyNews
text:
NYC's Civilian Complaint Review Board can investigate misconduct claims filed by one who saw video of an incident — even if they didn’t witness it, a court ruled.

The PBA had filed a lawsuit in 2018 arguing against the so-called “YouTube Complaints Rule."
https://t.co/6rfiNs7oq5

name: NYDailyNews
text:
George Floyd protests: Crowds smashed windows and threw smoke grenades at a CNN building in Atlanta, while the White House was locked down for an hour in D.C.

At least one tank was spotted in the streets, and a police car was seen engulfed in flames.
https://t.co/XMcBakQuF4

name: NYDailyNews
text:
UPDATE: Violent protesters charged a Brooklyn police precinct in a day of demonstrations over the killing of George Floyd in Minneapolis.

Early reports said windows at the precinct were broken and some shots were fired.
https://t.co/AIxHip8aK0
